page.title: 04Ecology in Chalton
page.content: Surveys of the flora and fauna were made at the following{grid references: {728174,732160,733152,734160,738162, {743141,744143,745155}SU71.{ {SOIL:}In general this was found to be of poor quality, being mainly chalk, with flint base. Where good soil was found,{grid ref.734160 }chalk subsoil was still close to the surface. {FLORA:}The majority of the area was of high downland. The species found were those typical to chalk downland. In more fertile areas:{grid ref.728174, {734160 }an abundance of plant life was found. {FAUNA:}In common with chalk downland, except for considerable evidence of rabbits,birds and some badgers, animal life was not abundant. In more sheltered areas,{grid ref.727174, {738162 }there was evidence of considerable animal activity.
